title: nf-cmgg/structural pipeline parameters
description: A bioinformatics best-practice analysis pipeline for calling structural variants (SVs), copy number variants (CNVs) and repeat region expansions (RREs) from short DNA reads

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

reference_genome_options.title: Reference genome options
reference_genome_options.description: Reference genome related files and options required for the workflow.

genome.help_text:
If using a reference genome configured in the pipeline using iGenomes, use this parameter to give the ID for the reference. This is then used to build the full paths for all required reference genome files e.g. `--genome GRCh38`. 

See the [nf-core website docs](https://nf-co.re/usage/reference_genomes) for more details.

fasta.help_text: This parameter is *mandatory* if `--genome` is not specified.

fai.description: The index of the FASTA reference file

qdnaseq_male.description: Path to the male qdnaseq reference file

qdnaseq_female.description: Path to the female qdnaseq reference file

wisecondorx_reference.description: Path to the wisecondorx reference file

blacklist.description: Path to the blacklist BED file

igenomes_ignore.description: Do not load the iGenomes reference config.
igenomes_ignore.help_text: Do not load `igenomes.config` when running the pipeline. You may choose this option if you observe clashes between custom parameters and those supplied in `igenomes.config`.

igenomes_base.description: The base path where the iGenomes references can be found

genomes_base.description: The base path where the references can be found

genomes_ignore.description: Whether or not to use the references found in the `--genomes_base` folder

cmgg_config_base.description: The config base path for the cmgg configs

genomes.description: A map containing all references for all genomes

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

multiqc_logo.description: Custom logo file to supply to MultiQC. File name must also be set in the MultiQC config file

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

pipelines_testdata_base_path.description: The base path to of the pipeline test data

pipeline_specific_options.title: Pipeline specific options
pipeline_specific_options.description: Options specific to the execution of this pipeline

callers.description: A comma-seperated list of callers to use. Can be one or more these: smoove/delly/manta/expansionhunter/qdnaseq/wisecondorx.
callers.help_text:
Following keywords can also be used as shortcuts to certain callers: 
- all: Use all callers
- sv: Use all SV callers
- cnv: Use all CNV callers
- rre: Use all RRE callers

output_callers.description: Output the VCF files from different callers. Warning: This produces a lot of additional output and should only be used for testing purposes

sv_callers_support.description: The minimum amount of SV callers that should detect a variant. All variants that have a lower amount of callers supporting it, will be removed. (Only used when more than one caller is given)

cnv_callers_support.description: The minimum amount of CNV callers that should detect a variant. All variants that have a lower amount of callers supporting it, will be removed. (Only used when more than one caller is given)

annotate.description: Run the annotation with Ensembl VEP and AnnotSV (and optionally VCFanno).

concat_output.description: Also output a concatenated VCF with all variant types analysed included.

annotations_filter.description: The filter arguments to use after annotating.
annotations_filter.help_text: A common use case for this is to filter out common variants. You can supply a VCF file with common variants to VCFanno and filter out the matching variants using this parameter

bedpe.description: Output BEDPE files derived from the VCF files alongside the VCF files

delly_parameters.title: Delly parameters
delly_parameters.description: Options specific for the Delly execution

delly_map_qual.description: The mapping quality to use for delly

delly_min_clique_size.description: The minimum clique size to use for delly

manta_parameters.title: Manta parameters
manta_parameters.description: Options specific for the Manta execution

manta_config.description: A config file to supply to manta

qdnaseq_parameters.title: qDNAseq parameters
qdnaseq_parameters.description: Options specific for the qDNAseq execution

qdnaseq_bin_size.description: The bin size to use for qdnaseq.

qdnaseq_cnv_ratio.description: The minimum value of the absolute cnv ratio for a variant to be considered a CNV.

vep_options.title: VEP options
vep_options.description: Options for the annotation with VEP

vep_assembly.description: The genome assembly to download the cache of.
vep_assembly.help_text: This only needs to be supplied when no vep_cache is given

vep_cache_version.description: The version of the VEP cache to use.
vep_cache_version.help_text: This version should be present in the folder supplied by `--vep_cache`. This version should be the same as `--vep_version` when no VEP cache was given with `--vep_cache`

vep_cache.description: The path to the VEP cache folder

vep_version.description: The version of VEP to use

species.description: The species used for the analysis. Should be all lowercase and spaces should be underscorses.

annotsv_options.title: AnnotSV options
annotsv_options.description: Options specific to the execution of AnnotSV

annotsv_annotations.description: The full path to the AnnotSV annotations folder. This can be a tarzipped folder.
annotsv_annotations.help_text: When --annotate is set to true and this isn't given, the annotations will be downloaded automatically (this is not recommended though).

annotsv_candidate_genes.description: The full path the candidate genes file for AnnotSV

annotsv_gene_transcripts.description: The full path to the gene transcripts file for AnnotSV

vcfanno_options.title: VCFanno options
vcfanno_options.description: Options for the execution of AnnotSV

vcfanno_toml.description: The full path to the VCFanno config TOML file. This file will be used to dynamically overwrite default configs for this pipeline run

vcfanno_lua.description: The full path to a lua script for VCFanno

vcfanno_resources.description: A comma-delimited list of files referenced in the VCFanno config and their indices.
vcfanno_resources.help_text: This can contain glob patterns as well. Place all filenames together between double qoutes to not cause any irregularities
